pullRequest.body:
Introduction of the real-valued exponential PDF and CDF

Co-authored-by: Patrick Massot <patrickmassot@free.fr>

---

First PR
 there might still be a few things wrong. Thank you for your help and work!

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Thanks for the PR!
You should add labels to the PR: awaiting-review if you want someone to look at it, WIP if you are still refining it. Also please add the label t-measure-probability to help sorting the PR for review.
Please also change the title of the PR to follow our conventions: https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/commit.html

Dear RÃ©my, 
thank you for all your help! I was not sure how to commit while quoting your suggestions, giving that most of them were an example of a mistake that I made a lot of in my file, so I tried to do some smaller commits regarding one or two of your suggestions each and also removing some more useless parantheses. 
I hope that these problems are now resolved and look forward to working on the functionality of my code!

My comments above are the last round. I think this PR now looks good and is almost ready to be merged.
Thanks for the contribution and for implementing all these changes!

:v: ClausenCl can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6949993534/job/18909268921)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6949993534/job/18909268577)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6949993534/job/18909269070)

Thanks! There is just one last remark. Once you have resolved it and the PR builds, you can merge yourself by writing `bors r+`
bors d+

Thanks again for the PR! Here is a first round of comments about style and formatting. It's completely normal for a first PR to get many of those.

I'll do a second pass over this PR after that to review the content.

Second round of comments! This time more about the code, but there are still style comments.

Github hides some of the comments because there are many: click on the button that reads "9 hidden conversations" to see them.

Thanks for the updates! I am very sorry that it took me so long to come back to this PR. Here are more comments (which should almost be the last), this time mostly about how we name lemmas. A useful reference for that is https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html

Thanks! There is just one last remark. Once you have resolved it and the PR builds, you can merge yourself by writing `bors r+`
bors d+

In mathlib we tend to avoid `â¥` to keep things predictable:
```suggestion
lemma compl_setOf_le (y : â) : {x : â | y â¤ x}á¶ =  {x | x < y} := by
```

A `;` at the end of a line does not do anything. You should remove them everywhere.
```suggestion
  ext x
```

After `<;>`, either put the next tactic on the same line or indent.
```suggestion
  constructor <;>
    simp only [ge_iff_le, mem_compl_iff, mem_setOf_eq, not_le, imp_self]
```

Please review the spaces in the file. For example, here you had two spaces:
```suggestion
lemma compl_setOf_le (y : â) : {x : â | y â¤ x}á¶ = {x | x < y} := by
```

Spaces:
```suggestion
lemma lintegral_split_bounded {y z : â} (f : â â ENNReal) (hzy : z â¤ y) :
```
I will not mark them in the whole file yet because there are many. Please check that!

Most often, you don't need to specify the type of the variable over which you integrate.
```suggestion
    â«â» x in Iic y, f x  = â«â» x in Iio z, f x + â«â» x in Icc z y, f x := by
```
Also I think these parentheses are not needed.
Did that, but I think the parantheses are needed if the integral is written without its measure, at least that gives me an error

We use arrows instead of symm inside of `rw`:
```suggestion
  rw [â Iio_union_Icc_eq_Iic hzy, lintegral_union measurableSet_Icc]
```

You are in the namespace `ProbabilityTheory`, so you can shorten all the names of that namespace:
```suggestion
    cdf (expMeasure r)
```

```suggestion
  if 0 â¤ x then r*exp (-(r*x)) else 0
```

Several things about this lemma:
- this is provable by `ext; simp`
- for that reason, we probably don't need it (see my other comment at the point where you used it)
- if we needed it, this file is not the right place

```suggestion
/-- A Lebesgue Integral from -â to y can be expressed as the sum of one from -â to 0 and 0 to x -/
```

```suggestion
  Â· exact measurableSet_Ici
```

`unfold` is useful for you when writing the code, but the `refine` tactic on the next line does not need it.
```suggestion
```

`ENNReal.ofReal 0` is just 0:
```suggestion
    â«â» y in Iio x, exponentialPdf r y = 0 := by
```

```suggestion
lemma exponentialPdf_eq (r x : â) :
```

You don't have to unfold on separate lines, you can pass the definition to rw or simp
```suggestion
  rw [exponentialCdfReal, cdf_eq_toReal]
  simp only [expMeasure, measurableSet_Iic, withDensity_apply]
```

There is also a `rfl` tactic:
```suggestion
  rfl
```

```suggestion
  simp only [exponentialCdfReal, exponentialPdf, cdf_eq_toReal]
  simp only [expMeasure, measurableSet_Iic, withDensity_apply]
```

```suggestion
  measure_univ := by simp [expMeasure, lintegral_exponentialPdf_eq_one r Fact.out]
```

Please use only one tactic per line, unless you are closing a trivial goal in one line.
Also, the `simp only [ge_iff_le] at h` was apparently not necessary.
```suggestion
  intro x hx
  split_ifs with h
  Â· rfl
```

It makes more sense to split the line like this, to have the result on its own line.
```suggestion
lemma lintegral_split (f : â â ENNReal) (c : â) :
    â«â» x, f x = (â«â» x in {x | x â¥ c}, f x) + â«â» x in {x | x < c}, f x := by
```

I don't think that this notation is useful: it is not used much and it obfuscates the statements. I'd rather have `exponentialPdfReal` in full.
```suggestion
```

Please write one tactic per line. Also you can combine those two:
```suggestion
  simp only [leftSide, add_zero]
```

`contrapose!` will simplify the negations. Then, `assumption` is able to close the goal.
```suggestion
  Â· contrapose! h; assumption
```

```suggestion
  Â· exact tendsto_const_nhds
  Â· apply tendsto_exp_neg_atTop_nhds_0.comp
    exact (tendsto_const_mul_atTop_of_pos hr).2 tendsto_id
```

Several things here:
- all lemmas in mathlib use `â¤` instead of `â¥` so it's better to use `0 â¤ x`
- the proof can be made very simple
- the name is not specific enough: this is not about any `if`, it's about the particular one in `exponentialPdf`
- this should probably be rewritten as a lemma about `exponentialPdf`
```suggestion
    ENNReal.ofReal (if 0 â¤ x then r * rexp (-(r * x)) else 0) = 0 :=
  ae_of_all _ (fun x hx â¦ by simp [not_le.mpr hx])
```

Hey, I did that but feel the exact lines in the new exponentialPdf_eval_pos and exponentialPdf_eval_neg could be moved into the simp, I did not manage how to do that though. Is that a useful simplification and, if yes, how can I archive that?

`restrictâ` is not the standard way to talk about restriction of a measure (it's the restriction as a linear map). use `restrict`.
```suggestion
  have hf : 0 â¤áµ[volume.restrict {x : â | x â¥ 0}] (fun x â¦ r * (rexp (-(r * x)))) := by
    apply ae_of_all
    intro a
    positivity
  rw [â integral_eq_lintegral_of_nonneg_ae hf]
```
Also, this could all be simplified to `rw [â integral_eq_lintegral_of_nonneg_ae (ae_of_all _ (fun _ â¦ by positivity))]`, without the `have`. But you don't have to follow that suggestion if you prefer the `have` statement.

Let's remove that notation as well. It is only used once. I'll add that having the same notation for two different things in the same file is not great for readability!
```suggestion
```

Please use the notation `ââ¥0â` to denote `ENNReal` (everywhere in the file)
```suggestion
lemma lintegral_split_bounded {y z : â} (f : â â ââ¥0â) (hzy : z â¤ y) :
```
That name should be more specific. What about `lintegral_Iic_eq_lintegral_Iio_add_Icc`?

Why not use the intervals `Ixx` here as well?
```suggestion
lemma lintegral_eq_lintegral_Ici_add_Iio (f : â â ââ¥0â) (c : â) :
    â«â» x, f x = (â«â» x in Ici c, f x) + â«â» x in Iio c, f x := by
```

Our usual spacing is this:
```suggestion
lemma exponentialPdf_eval_pos {r : â} : âáµ x : â âvolume, x < 0 â
```
I don't understand how that name relates to the statement. I would expect something like `hasDerivAt_...`

This name is way to generic: it's not about any Lebesgue integral. Also when a part of the name refers to a hypothesis (like `nonpos` here), we prefix it with `of`:
```suggestion
lemma lintegral_exponentialPdf_of_nonpos {x r : â} (hx : x â¤ 0) :
```

Hypotheses/arguments before the `:` instead of in a \forall
```suggestion
lemma exponentialPdfReal_nonneg {r : â} (hr : 0 < r) (x : â) :
    0 â¤ exponentialPdfReal r x := by
```

A better way to split lines:
```suggestion
lemma exponentialPdf_eval_neg {r : â} :
    âáµ x : â âvolume, (x â {x | 0 â¤ x} â
      exponentialPdf r x = ENNReal.ofReal (r * rexp (-(r * x)))) := by
```

But the main issue with that lemma is that it should not be about almost everywhere equality, but about equality. You should introduce this:
```lean
lemma exponentialPdf_of_nonneg {r x : â} (hx : 0 â¤ x) :
    exponentialPdf r x = ENNReal.ofReal (r * rexp (-(r * x))) := by
  rw [exponentialPdf_eq, if_pos hx]
```
(to be placed next to `exponentialPdf_eq`)
Then you don't even need the current form because it's an immediate combination of that and `ae_of_all`.

~~The remark in that comment about removing the lemma in favor of a lemma about equality instead of a.e. equality still stands. Same for the eval_pos lemma.~~
Sorry, I think I looked at an outdated version?

Pleast change the name to something starting with `tendsto-...` and mentioning exp. Also it shoud be placed in another file because it's a general result about exp and not specific to the construction of the exponential distribution. Perhaps put it close to the lemmas you use in the proof, like `tendsto_exp_neg_atTop_nhds_0`?

I decided to delete the lemma as I only used it once and feel like a tendsto of the derivative of a special case of the neg exponential is to specific for exp.lean. Let me know if you disagree, then I would transfer it there

This is about exponentialPdf, not exponentialPdfreal
```suggestion
lemma lintegral_exponentialPdf_eq_one (r : â) (hr : 0 < r) :
    â«â» x, exponentialPdf r x = 1 := by
```

This is just a copy of the lemma above?
```suggestion
```

The name of the object is exponentialCdfReal, not expCdf. Also it's better to add an argument that to write an equality of functions:
```suggestion
lemma exponentialCdfReal_eq_integral (r : â) [Fact (0 < r)] (x : â) :
    exponentialCdfReal r x = â« x in Iic x, exponentialPdfReal r x := by
```

```suggestion
lemma exponentialCdf_eq_lintegral (r x : â) [Fact (0 < r)] :
    exponentialCdfReal r x = ENNReal.toReal (â«â» x in Iic x, exponentialPdf r x) := by
```

```suggestion
/-- The Definition of the CDF equals the known Formular `1 - exp (-(r * x))`. -/
lemma exponentialCdfReal_eq {r : â} [Fact (0 < r)] (x : â) :
    exponentialCdfReal r x = if 0 â¤ x then 1 - exp (-(r * x)) else 0 := by
  rw [exponentialCdf_eq_lintegral, lint_eq_antiDeriv _ Fact.out, ENNReal.toReal_ofReal_eq_iff]
```

This `simp` does not close all goals, which make it a non-terminal simp. Those are bad, because what simp does depends on which lemmas are tagged simp in the whole library. It might be that in the future, that simp suddenly simplifies to something slightly different and then the next line won't work, and it will be difficult to reconstruct what it should have simplified to.
That's why we should replace all non-terminal simp by `simp only` (use `simp?` and replace with the suggestion).

When `apply` closes a goal, it's better for readability of the proof to use `exact` instead:
```suggestion
      exact Integrable.const_mul (exp_neg_integrableOn_Ioc hr) _
```

```suggestion
      exact Integrable.const_mul (exp_neg_integrableOn_Ioc hr) _
```

Rename. `hasDerivAr_neg_exp_mul_exp`?
Also why is there a `-1 * exp` in the statement? This should just be `- exp`

```suggestion
lemma exponentialPdf_of_nonneg {r x : â} (hx : 0 â¤ x) :
```
Also please put that lemma next to `exponentialPdf_eq`

Same as for the other one, let's replace a.e. equality with the stronger equality:
```suggestion
lemma exponentialPdf_of_neg {r x : â} (hx : x < 0) :
    exponentialPdf r x = 0 := by
  simp only [exponentialPdf_eq, if_neg (not_le.mpr hx)]
```
(proof untested)
And please move it next to `exponentialPdf_eq`.

```suggestion
lemma exponentialCdfReal_eq {r : â} [Fact (0 < r)] (x : â) :
    exponentialCdfReal r x = if 0 â¤ x then 1 - exp (-(r * x)) else 0 := by
```

```suggestion
    â«â» y in Iic x, exponentialPdf r y
      = ENNReal.ofReal (if 0 â¤ x then 1 - exp (-(r * x)) else 0) := by
```
Can you move this next to `hasDerivAt_exp_neg`?

```suggestion
* `exponentialCdfReal_eq`: Proof that the `exponentialCdfReal` given by the Definition equals the known
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Real Exponential Distribution

You should add labels to the PR: awaiting-review if you want someone to look at it, WIP if you are still refining it. Also please add the label t-measure-probability to help sorting the PR for review.
Please also change the title of the PR to follow our conventions: https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/commit.html

I'll do a second pass over this PR after that to review the content.

Dear RÃ©my, 
thank you for all your help! I was not sure how to commit while quoting your suggestions, giving that most of them were an example of a mistake that I made a lot of in my file, so I tried to do some smaller commits regarding one or two of your suggestions each and also removing some more useless parantheses. 
I hope that these problems are now resolved and look forward to working on the functionality of my code!

Second round of comments! This time more about the code, but there are still style comments.

Github hides some of the comments because there are many: click on the button that reads "9 hidden conversations" to see them.
